notesStmt.note: Alessandro de Caii: inscribed with his name, 1589 (?) (folio 181v). Laurentius Franguellus (fl. until 1596): inscribed with his name, 1575 (folio 181v); see 78. Illegible inscription, probably censor's signature (folio 181v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Naḥmanides (Moshe ben Nahman aka ha-Ramban) on the Pentateuch in the abridged form.

collation.p: 19 quires: i-xviii10 (folios 1-180), xix2 (folios 181-[182]). Catchwords at the end of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated. Probably of the 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: Numerous initial-word panels with penwork decoration and pen-flourishing, sometimes inhabited or accompanied with animals and hybrids in the margins, in red and mauve ink.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Moses ben Nachman. Comm. on the Pentateuch. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,933.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: his manuscript no. 41; 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library in October 1865 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153).
